Hello Guillaume,

Thank you for your reply. I am glad that you were able to=
 compile it with VC++ 2005 Express. I am using the same version. I do not h=
ave Matlab. 

When compiling 'ctpython and 'ctMatlab' fails with the linkin=
g error saying "cannot open input file cvode.lib". But ctcxx compiles well.=


Again compiling 'clib' fails with the same linking error message. Compila=
tion of 'ck2cti' fails with due to linking error with messages saying "unre=
solved externals".

I was also trying to use Fortran 77 example in "C:\Calc=
\cantera\tools\templates\f77" directory. But keep getting message about mis=
sing header files. I am using Visual Fortran 5. 

I will greatly appreciate=
 your help in getting me started with Cantera. 

Thanks a lot,
Chitral Naik=

Ph: 650-455-6545

----- Original Message ----
From: Guillaume Daill <guill=
aume.daill@...>
To: cantera@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, December=
 6, 2006 10:02:36 AM
Subject: Re: [cantera] Compiling using VC6




I have =
successfully compiled cantera 1.7 with Visual C++ 2005 Express (it is free =
but you must register)

http://msdn.microsoft.com/vstudio/express/visualc/d=
efault.aspx


enjoy :)

Guillaume

2006/12/5, chitral_naik <chitral_naik@ya=
hoo.com>:













  


    
            Hi, I am new to Cantera. 

I a=
m trying to compile Cantera 1.7 on VC6 platform. I have installed

Python, =
Numarray, and Sundials. Then I opened cantera.dsw from

C:\Test\cantera\vc6=
 in VC6. But the compilation fails.



Is Cantera1.7 not compatible with VC=
6? My ultimate goal is to compile

it with Digita Fortran 5.



Thanks,

Ch=
itral





    
  

    
    

















-- 
DAILL Guillaume
